data.mObtainable_way:
Carrot seed can be obtained by the following ways:
1. Has a 100% chance to be in stock in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase a seed for 10 Sheckles or 7 Roblux.
2. Lucky Harvest
3. Stolen by a Red Fox
4. Snail, yield a seed when harvest
5. Often dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
6. Rarely obtained by a Squirrel (dupes) while planting the same seed
data.mTrivia:
This is the first crop that anyone can plant and buy in-game
.The Carrot takes about 6.5 seconds to fully grow, which is really quick
.The Easter Event 2025 variant of this crop is the Chocolate Carrot
.The Carrot can be eaten by a Bunny and the Black Bunny.

data.mObtainable_way:
Strawberry seed could be obtained by the following ways:
1. Has a 100% chance to be in stock in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase a seed for 50 Sheckles or 21 Roblux.
2. Lucky Harvest
3. Stolen by a Red Fox
4. Snail, yield a seed when harvest
5. Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
6. Rarely obtained by a Squirrel (dupes) while planting the same seed
data.mTrivia:
- Strawberry takes 10 seconds for the crop to grow and produces its berries in 5 to 8 seconds.
- A Strawberry's max wield is 5.
- In the past, buying a Strawberry seed for 21 Roblux, would instead give the player a Cherry Blossom seed. This issue has since been patched.

data.mObtainable_way:
The Chocolate Carrot seed was previously obtained in the following ways
1. Chocolate Carrot seed had a 100% chance to be in stock in Poppy's Easter Shop. A user could purchase a seed for 10,000 Sheckles or 99 Roblux.
2. Gaining enough points during the Summer Harvest Event.
The intended method to obtain a Pink Tulip is unknown. It is currently unobtainable and requires admin-rights or testing-rights to acquire.
data.mTrivia: The Pink Tulip model was used as decoration in the Bizzy Bee Event area.

- A Blueberry crop takes 105 seconds to fully grow, and one Blueberry takes approximately 22 seconds.

data.mTrivia:
- Shocked Glowshrooms do not look significantly different at all compared to a regular Mushroom.
- The Glowshroom is very similar to Lilac, as they both have a base plant that grows their fruits around them.
- The main Glowshroom has a small chance of growing a larger or same sized Glowshroom. These have the chance to then become its own "parent" Glowshroom, growing more around it.
- The Glowshroom is considered a "Night type fruit" as it was obtainable in the Lunar Glow Event.

- The Nectarshade initially didn't exist in the Bizzy Bee Event; this is because it was later added in the update expansion on June 7th.
- Nectarshades are much smaller than they may look.

data.mObtainable_way:
The Guanabana is obtainable through crafting at the Seed Crafting Table at the back of the map.
The Guanabana is crafted with:
1 Aloe Vera seed
 + 1 Prickly Pear seed
 + 1 Banana
 + 30 Summer Sheckles
Craft Time: 10 minutes

This crafting time can also be skipped with 779 Roblux.
data.mTrivia:
- Even if there is a Guanabana smaller than 3.8kg, its price will still be 63,626 Sheckles.
- The Guanabana seed shares the same model with the Prickly Pear seed, the only difference being the color.
- The Guanabana is based on the soursop in real life, which is known as the guanábana in Latin America.
Even though guanabana is considered a prickly fruit, it is not affected by hedgehogs.

data.mObtainable_way:
The Coconut seed can be obtained in the following ways:
1. Has a 2% (1/50) chance to be in stock in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase a seed for 6,000 Sheckles or 597 Roblux.
2. Lucky Harvest
3. Stolen by a Red Fox
4. Snail, yield a seed when harvested
5. Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
6. Rarely obtained by a Squirrel (dupes) while planting the same seed
7. Reclaimed via the Reclaimer gear
8. ~3% chance of obtaining after shoveling via Seagull
data.mTrivia:
A Coconut crop's growth time can take 6 to 12 hours. This is the slowest plant in the game to grow, where 2nd and 3rd are Cocovine and Guanabana respectively.
There is a glitch where sometimes 2 coconuts can grow in the same space.
Coconuts have a base size of roughly 10kg, making them ideal candidates for pollination.
There's a visual bug involving the coconut crops, where if the player rejoins the game, all of their size is set to one specific size. This however doesn't change their size upon harvest.

data.mObtainable_way:

1. A Cactus seed has a 3.33% chance (1/30) to be in stock in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase a seed for 15,000 Sheckles or 497 Roblux.
2. Cactus seed can still be obtained in the following ways:
1. Normal Seed Pack
2. Lucky Harvest
3. Stolen by a Red Fox
4. Snail, yield a seed when harvested
Rarely obtained by a Squirrel (dupes) while planting the same seed
data.mTrivia:
The Cactus crop generally grows taller than a user's avatar.
Feeding equation: 7572.12 * 1.035WEIGHT (KG) (points: 24.83kg/17 830 HGR and 112.36kg/364 990 HGR
The spikes on the Cactus don't scale with KG, they are merely cosmetic. Nevertheless, the flower on its top scales with KG.

data.mObtainable_way: The Moonglow had a 5% chance to be obtained from the Night Seed Pack, and a 12% chance to be obtained from the Premium Night Seed Pack.
data.mTrivia:
- Formerly, the Moonglow's seed was shorter than other seeds, while it was missing its neon section. It has since been fixed.
- The Moonglow is similar to the Pineapple, being short crops with a crown of leaves that produce one fruit at a time.
- If a player touches the Moonglow, it will temporarily light up.
- Golden and Chocolate Moonglows have a studded texture that removes the fruit’s neon glow. These are the only mutations that change the texture of the Moonglow.
- The Frozen Mutation removes the transparent coating around a Moonglow, resulting in the fruit losing its glow.
- The Moonglow is one of the only crops that emit light along with the Lumira and Firefly Fern.

data.mObtainable_way:
The Moon Melon seed was previously obtained in the following ways:
1. Purchased during the Blood Moon in the Blood Moon Shop for  500,000 or 729.
The Moon Melon seed can still be obtained in the following ways:
1. Gaining enough points during the Summer Harvest Event.
data.mTrivia:
- Moon Melons are often used as substitutes for Candy Blossoms.
- There is currently a strategy involving spamming sprinklers around the Moon Melon crop and leaving the game for about an hour, and returning to massive fruits — around 30-50kg in size — resulting in sell prices rivaling Candy Blossoms after applying certain mutations. Hence, it is considered one of the best fruits for grinding sheckles.
- Moon Melons are considered a "Night type" fruit.
- Moon Melons (along with Watermelon and Pumpkin) are affected by the Sweet Soaker Sprinkler.

data.mTrivia:
The Blood Banana is considered a "Night Type Fruit".
It is inspired by the Banana from the Exotic Seed Pack.
Once fully grown, players can harvest from 2 to 4 Blood Bananas per yield, with a similar concept of the Banana.
Blood Bananas were inspired by fruits, named Banana Yucca.

data.mObtainable_way:

1. Purchased during the Night event after Update 1.07.1 in the Twilight Shop for 15,000,000 Sheckles or 599 Roblux.
The Celestiberry can still be obtained from the following ways:
1. Gaining enough points during the Summer Harvest Event.
data.mTrivia:
The Celestiberry was added as part of an apology for the poorly-received Update 1.07.0.
The fruit of the Celestiberry share the same model with the fruit of the Raspberry, and the plant shares the same model with the scrapped Crimson Vine Blood Moon Event crop. The only difference is that the Celestiberry models all use shades of blue.
The plant is the remastered version of the Crimson Vine.
The Celestiberry seed has the 3rd highest price, tied with Ember Lily and behind Moon Mango and Sugar Apple.
The Celestiberry is considered a "Night type" fruit.
When the Berry Blusher Sprinkler first released, The Celestiberry was not boosted by it along with the Raspberry. This was fixed in a patch.
The word "Celestiberry" is a compound name, where there are 2 words are combined/mixed into one, those words that are combined into Celestiberry are "Celestial" and "Berry"

data.mObtainable_way:
The Honeysuckle was formerly obtained after completing all 30 recipes for Bizzy Bear's quest, only one seed could be obtained per quest-cycle.

The Honeysuckle was later made available to craft at the Seed Crafting Table but later on it was moved to the cosmetics shop. As of June 28 2025, it has been made unobtainable upon the release of the second week of the Summer Harvest Event.
The Honeysuckle was crafted with:
1 Pink Lily seed
 + 1 Purple Dahlia seed
 + 80 Honey
Craft time: 24 minutes
It was also purchased with Robux
data.mTrivia:
The Honeysuckle's design originates from a giant Honeysuckle concept made by "JAYE!!!!!! ★ CINNAMON BOY" on Discord. [1]
The Honeysuckle’s minimum value and the base price is the same as the Candy Blossom.
It was a tropical plant before the Prehistoric Event and affected by Toucan. Players obtained Honeysuckles worth quadrillions (with mutations). The biggest Honeysuckle recorded weighed 42,000kg.
Honeysuckle was at risk of being nerfed but players voted for it to stay the same

data.mTrivia:
The Sunflower is the second type of sunflower in the game, the first one being Candy Sunflower.
The Sunflower plant takes approximately 30 minutes to fully grow.
The Sunflower seed is visually very similar to both the Pumpkin, Mango, Loquat, Pineapple and Hive Fruit seeds.
Upon release, the Sunflower had the highest base price in the game at 200,000 Sheckles(similar to Parasol Flower), but was later reduced down to 135,000 Sheckles and then raised back up to 144,000 Sheckles, before being buffed again to  160,000 Sheckles.
The Sunflower has the third highest base price in the game, only surpassed by the Parasol Flower and the Bone Blossom.
The Sunflower is one of the only plants to have a Mutation exclusive to itself, besides the Sugar Apple, being the Dawnbound mutation, obtainable from the Sun God event.
If a Sunflower gets the Gold and Shocked Mutations, the Sunflower will look like the Dawnbound Mutation.
There is a glitch where sometimes a Sunflower will produce 2 crops.
The Sunflower is the first multi-harvest sunflower type plant in the game.

data.mTrivia: The purple color on the back of the Fossilight does not match the color of the image representing it in the shop, where the back is more maroon.

data.mObtainable_way: Before April 21st, 2025, players could purchase a Strawberry from the Seed Shop for 21 Robux to obtain the Cherry Blossom seed. The Cherry Blossom seed has not returned and is currently unobtainable.
data.mTrivia:
The Cherry Blossom is one of four blossoms other than Candy Blossom, Moon Blossom and Bone Blossom.
The Cherry Blossom crop is based on the blossoms of the Cherry Tree, often referred to as “Sakura” in Japan, originating from China.
The Cherry Blossom may have inspired the Petal Bee's color scheme.
The produce is similar to the Moon Blossom.
This is likely because both are blossoms.
This is considered the cheapest high-tier fruit in the game, being only 500 sheckles at least. Many dislike it.

data.mTrivia:
The Moon Blossom is one of four blossoms other than Candy Blossom, Cherry Blossom and Bone Blossom.
There are two possible colors of the Moon Blossom tree: purple and blue.
Two plants within the blossom plant variety contain biologically accurate details, such as containing stamens & anther, both used for reproduction. These two plants are the Moon Blossom and Cherry Blossom.
The Moon Blossom had gotten a fix to its size, as a bug made it, so it was covering the majority of the map a day into the update release.
The Moon Blossom got a buff from a minimum value of 55,000 Sheckles to a minimum value of 60,166 Sheckles.
Each Moon Blossom crop has a randomized number and rotation of antennae.
Moon Blossom is one of the very few crops to return to the game during the Summer Harvest Event.
Moon Blossom is considered the weakest of all current seed pack's highest rarity fruit due to its low size variation and minimum value.

data.mTrivia:
The Moon Mango was added as part of an apology for the poorly-received Update 1.07.0.
The Moon Mango is the most expensive crop in the game.
Although the rarity of the Moon Mango is Divine (Orange), it will show Mythical (Purple) whenever a player hover to the Moon Mango plant. It is unsure whether they changed the rarity of the Moon Mango or if this a visual bug.
The Moon Mango is similar to the normal Mango, while being significantly smaller than a typical Mango tree and having a dark purple color scheme.
The Moon Mango is a slow growing crop.
During night events, Moon Mangos will grow faster.
When shoveling a Moon Mango, the text to confirm shows it's mythical, although it is originally divine.
Upon release, the Moon Mango had a minimum value of 22,563 Sheckles and got increased to 45,125 Sheckles.
The Moon Mango seed icon in the Twilight Shop and the actual in-game model have different textures.
The Moon Mango Seed got a buff due to backlash caused by it having a high seed price with a low sell price.
The Moon Mango is known in the GAG community as a 'scam' and a 'meme fruit'
The Moon Mango is considered a "Night type" fruit.

data.mObtainable_way:
The Hive Fruit seed was previously obtained in the following ways:

The Hive Fruit seed could be bought from the Honey Shop for 40 Honey or 599 Roblux.
data.mTrivia:
Its unique tree structure requires strategic garden planning to maximize yield.
The Hive Fruit grows differently than other plants. As the Hive Fruit grows, it starts off small, then its size gradually increases as it grows. This is different because most fruit extend or add more parts as it grows.
Sometimes the Hive Fruit can stay extremely small while growing, this makes it very difficult to harvest without the use of a harvest tool.
Hive Fruit is currently the plant with the most changes in base value. Starting off at 6,400 Sheckles and then 2 days after the Bizzy Bees Update it got changed to 23,145 Sheckles. A few days later it got buffed to 45,125 Sheckles. As of the Working Bees Update the base value of Hive Fruit has once again changed, this time to 55,955 Sheckles.
As of Update 1.10.0 the Hive Fruit's unique ability to release bees when it has the Pollinated mutation has been properly implemented, as it was broken in prior versions.
After being fully grown, Hive Fruit can produce from one to four crops, randomly distributing by its branches.
The Hive Fruit seed is visually very similar to both the Pumpkin, Mango, Loquat and Pineapple seeds.

data.mObtainable_way: The obtainment method of a Traveler's Fruit is from the Summer Shop. It is purchasable for 32 Summer Coins.
data.mTrivia:
This fruit is based on the Ravenala madagascariensis in real life, which has been given the name "Traveler's Tree", thus the name of the in-game fruit.
Traveler's Fruit plant was first seen at the Week 3 of Bizzy Bee Event leak image.

data.mObtainable_way:
The Beanstalk seed is obtained in the following ways:
1. Has a 0.48% (1/210) chance of being in stock in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase for 10,000,000 Sheckles or 715 Roblux in the Seed Shop.
2. Lucky Harvest
3. Stolen by a Red Fox
4. Snail, yields a seed when harvested
5. Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
6. Rarely given by a Squirrel while planting the same seed
data.mTrivia:
The Beanstalk was the first Prismatic crop to be released in-game.
This Plant Got Inspired By A Fairy Tale Name "Jack And The Beanstalk"
There was a bug when the Beanstalk was first released, where if a player purchased it with Robux, it would instead give them a Dragon Fruit seed.
The in-game Beanstalk is very similar in appearance to the titular beanstalk from Jack and The Beanstalk, being large, spiraling plants that sprout podded beans.
For some reason, when the crop focus switches from one Beanstalk crop to another, the text will be replaced with a rainbow emoji ("🌈") for a fraction of a second. This goes for every Prismatic plant. This is probably due to rainbow plants having the same text effect as Prismatic plants.
The beanstalk is the biggest showable crop (if it and the other plants are on normal size)
The fruits on a beanstalk can swap locations with other beanstalks on the same plant, making it more difficult to find a specific beanstalk the player wants to harvest.
Once fully grown, The Beanstalk produces at least 4 fruits per yield, which depends on the crop's height.

data.mObtainable_way:
The Ember Lily seed was previously obtained in the following ways:
1. Had a 0.02% chance to be in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase a seed for 15,000,000 Sheckles or 779 Roblux.
The Ember Lily seed can still be obtained in the following ways:
1. Lucky Harvest
2. Snail, yield a seed when harvest
3. Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
4. Summer rewards
data.mTrivia:
- The Ember Lily is one of the four Prismatic crops in the game.
- The Ember Lily seed has the 3rd highest cost to purchase, behind Sugar Apple and Moon Mango, also tied with Celestiberry.
- The Ember Lily's is based on the real-life Ember Lily flower.
- The Ember Lily's chance to be in the Seed Shop is 1/5.000 (0.02%) - which means it was predicted to have 1 to 2 in-stock every day.
- There is a bug where the Red Fox cannot steal an Ember Lily Seed.
- The Ember Lily has an average weight of 10.60 kg
- Ember Lilies in real life can change in color.

data.mObtainable_way:
Sugar Apple seed can be obtained in the following ways:
1. Has a 0.34% (1/290) chance to be in stock in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase a Sugar Apple seed for 25,000,000 Sheckles or 819 Roblux.
2. Lucky Harvest
3. "Stolen" by a Red Fox
4. SnaiI, rarely yielding a seed when harvesting
5. Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
data.mTrivia:
The Sugar Apple is the second Apple-Type plant added to the game. First was the red apple.
Because of this, if the player collects a golden Sugar Apple, it will award the "God apple!" badge.
The Sugar Apple is based on the actual sugar apple.
The Sugar Apple also has a chance to get ripe, which makes it turn a purplish color cosmetically.
The Sugar Apple is the 3rd most expensive crop at  25,000,000.
With most mutations, it adds a gradient to the apple.
The Sugar Apple gives 7 points during the Summer Harvest Event.

data.mObtainable_way:
The Burning Bud seed can be obtained in the following ways:
1. Has a 0.29% (1/340) chance to be in stock in the Seed Shop and can be purchased for 40,000,000 Sheckles or 915 Roblux.
2. Lucky Harvest.
3. Stolen by a Red Fox.
4. Snail, yield a seed when harvest.
5. Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab.
data.mTrivia:
"Burning Bud" has a chance to grow more than one branch during the growth stage. Each branch can grow into a flower independently. The experiment can be repeated through repeated planting. The current highest record is that one plant has grown four branches.
"Burning Bud" is one of the few plants that can grow quite large from a low kilo, even if the final price is not ideal.
In the first few moments of the Burning Bud's release, players discovered that the Toucan method worked on it, but it got patched after an hour.
Prior to its official release, the Burning Bud only grew 1 flower but had twice the price it currently has.
The Burning Bud was originally intended to be released earlier than the Prehistoric Update, but its release was stalled due to Roblox UK's moderation flagging the plant name as "inappropriate". This has since been resolved.
There is currently a bug where if the player has a growing/fully grown Burning Bud fruit before joining a server, it might appear invisible.
There is a small feature where the bottom flower is consistently much larger than the top flower.
On July 8th, Burning Bud came on stock for the first time and came in twice, only 10 minutes apart from each other. The chances of this occurring (based on the 0.29% chance of an appearance) would be 0.000863% (1/115900).
There were also 2 Sugar Apples and 1 Ember Lily in stock on the same day.
This and July 7th also could be the record for the most Prismatic tiers in the shop in a day, without any admin restocks.

Giant Pinecone base value was nerfed from  100,000 to  72577 which means a reduction of 27.42%.
If the player gets a Lucky Harvest on a Giant Pinecone, the seed will spin down to the ground.

data.mObtainable_way: The Bone Blossom can be obtained by completing 21 Dino Quests. Quests can be skipped with  Robux, however, skipping quests does not skip the timer. Quests refresh every 12 hours, with 3 randomly generated quests every time, meaning players can obtain the bone blossom in 3.5 days if they are consistent.
data.mTrivia:
The Bone Blossom is one of the four blossoms, other than Candy Blossom, Moon Blossom and Cherry Blossom.
The center part of the Bone Blossom fruit looks similar to a Peach and Nectarine.
Prior to its release, Jandel hinted toward a new Blossom-type seed that is supposed to be better than Candy Blossom, known to be the best seed in the game. This seed is confirmed to be it, as stated by Jandel after its release.
It is currently the first "Transcendent" rarity crop introduced in the game.
The Bone Blossom is a slow growing crop.
The Bone Blossom was unobtainable without admin or tester permissions for 3 and a half days after the release of the prehistoric event, which is 84 hours.
It produce 4 crops at the time.

The plant itself appears similarly to a Cocovine, but with a Purple and Maroon colour scheme and thorns trailing the stem.
The fruit of a Twisted Tangle appears to be a spiky version of the lingonberry, with a dark-yellow body with a leaf on top.
The intended obtainment method of a Twisted Tangle is through crafting. It can be obtained by crafting it with 1x Cactus Seed, 1x Bamboo Seed, 1x Cactus, 1x Mango, and 50,000 Sheckles.
data.mTrivia: The Twisted Tangle currently has a bug where only the thorns cast a shadow, rather than the entire plant and fruit.
